gstore.lucene

Class SearcherPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • gstore.lucene.SearcherPool

  • public class SearcherPool
extends Object
    SearcherPool is a pool of objects of type IndexSearcher2 (an extension to Lucene's IndexSearcher with some added fields). The pool returns new objects, or used objects by ID. Objects are recycled or closed after some time if unused, and only if the number of allocated objects is above some number. The motivation for this class is to serve as a supplier of searchers for a web application, where each searcher is used in one thread but needs to maintain its state through subsequent queries, in order to achieve paging consistency.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SearcherPool(org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter writer, int n, int ms)
      Create an empty pool of searchers and start a cleaning thread that will be executed each ms milliseconds.

    • Method Detail

      • acquire

        public IndexSearcher2 acquire()
                       throws IOException
        Return a new or unused searcher. Reset its time stamp and give it an 'new' id. id's are natural numbers that overlap when id>max(long), but that should not happen very often.
        Throws:
        IOException
